fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After the site rename, all the issues that have a confluence page linked to it were affected. When I check the issue, all the confluence links are showing an error message: "Confluence site not linked". However, If I click on the confluence link, I'm able to access it. The problem is that it is only showing an error message instead of the information of the confluence link.

I've also linked a confluence page after the site rename and the error was not shown, the problem is only for the links previously linked with an issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue.
 # Link a confluence page to the issue.
 # Rename the instance.
 # Check the confluence link on the issue.

h3. Expected Results

I'm able to see the confluence link without the error message.
h3. Actual Results

I'm not able to see the confluence link title, only if I open it I will see what is inside of this link.

 
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Confluence link showing an error message after the site rename

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira email notifications triggered by adding GIFs in issue comments don't render GIFs in the notifications and shows an error message

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Jira issue, add a GIF from GIPHY in issue comments
# Check the Jira email notification received for the above action 
# Notification shows below error message
Unable to embed resource: <GIF name> of type application/octet-stream

h3. Expected Result
GIFs should be rendered in Jira notifications 

h3. Actual Result
GIFs fails to render and shows an error message

Note: The email notification format is set to HTML in Jira system default user preferences and user personal settings

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira notifications don't render GIFs added using GIPHY

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a ticket if you start typing the Epic in the Epic link field and then with the keyboard arrows select the Epic and hit enter/return, an error is displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start the creation process
 # In the creation screen start typing in the Epic link field
 # Select one of the epics with the keyboard and hit enter/return
 [https://share.getcloudapp.com/xQuLzR0g]

h3. Expected Results

The Epic highlighted will be select, this happens if nothing is typed in the field
h3. Actual Results

An error is displayed "Epic with key 'epic' does not exist."
 [https://share.getcloudapp.com/xQuLzR0g]
h3. Workaround

Select the Epic with the space bar instead of the enter key
fields.summary: Not able to select an Epic with the keyboard in the creation screen

fields.description:
Currently, when viewing an issue in the new issue view, the main body of the issue has its own section (and scrollbar) as does the contextual fields section.

Some users find it annoying that there are multiple sections with their own scrollbars and it would be nice if there was an option for users to configure that would affectively combine those two sections into a single section with a single scroll bar.
fields.summary: Ability to disable the multiple sections with two separate scroll bars in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you create a post-function on the workflow to add %%CURRENT_DATETIME%% on a custom field Date Picker field, it comers one day after date. It depends on what time you trigger this post-function. 
Here we have an example:
!Screen Shot 2020-08-26 at 17.03.02.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a post-function on the workflow to edit Date Picker field with %%CURRENT_DATETIME%%;
 # Perform the steps to trigger the post-function;
 # Normally it happens at the end of the day;

h3. Expected Results

Date in *Date Picker field* displays the *correct* date. (i.e. in the user's timezone)
h3. Actual Results

Date in *Date Picker field* displays the *wrong* date. (it displays the date using the Jira System timezone settings)
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround using a *Date Picker Field* for this matter.

However, a *Date/Time Picker Field* could be utilized instead, which will correctly display the date and time in the user's timezone.
fields.summary: %%CURRENT_DATETIME%% in post function doesn't set the correct date on Date Picker fields

fields.description:
Users need to put relevant information in the project description field that is required as for example if the project has sensitive data, currently, the project description is optional so users can leave it blank.

Adding the possibility to make it required could be helpful.
fields.summary: Ability to make the project description field required on project creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While navigating anonymously in the all issues filter page from a public project, selecting different issues than the first one makes the page to load again showing only the details from the first one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make a project public
 # In incognito window access the All issues filter from that project, for example, https://<site name>.atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/<project key>/issues?filter=allissues
# Try to select different issues from the results
https://share.getcloudapp.com/Blu5oP8E

h3. Expected Results
The selected issue details should be displayed in the same page

h3. Actual Results
The page is reloaded automatically selecting again the first issue

h3. Workaround

Open the issues in different tabs by right-clicking and selecting open in a new tab
fields.summary: Public issues not loading in the same issue view page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding attachments with comments using the log work functionality may cause the comment the be lost or the attachment to now be adde.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and go to the *...* > *Log work* 
 # Add a value to *Time spent*, "5m" as example
 # Then at the comment section write a comment, then add a .doc or .txt below this first comment, then add a comment below the attachment

h3. Expected Results

The comments above and below the attachment are added, as well as the attachment.

 !expected.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Testing on JSD classic projects what happens is that only the comment above is added, and the comment below as well as the attachment are lost. 

 !JSD.png|thumbnail! 

Testing with JSW classic projects, sometimes the attachment is the only information added, other times the comments are added without the attachment.

 !Jira software.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue with adding attachments ( .doc, .txt ) on Log work comments
Display more data on audit log about filter condition changes

fields.description:
Currently if user is not part of administrator group, having a *Make bulk changes* permissions also let them use csv import feature from *global issue navigation* page.

Request- 
To have a separate feature to control permissions for csv import and bulk change.
fields.summary: Ability to control the bulk change action and csv import permission separately.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently it is not possible to do attach file when sending bulk emails from cloud site. It will be good to have this feature to send an error message that is occuring in case of an outage.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira settings -> System -> send email
 # You cannot see an option to attach files. !image-2020-08-26-13-27-28-358.png|width=389,height=222!

h3. Expected Results

We get an option to attach file to bulk send to set of users.
h3. Actual Results

We will not be able to attach.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Attaching file(s) while sending bulk email from cloud site

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When there is an error to the automation rules, what is shown in the logs is the user name and sometimes the user name doesn't reflect what user is this.

h3. Suggested resolution
Show the display name instead of user name in the automation logs.
fields.summary: Show the user's display name instead of user name in the automation logs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a project only contains Epics, quick creating an Epic Child is not displaying any error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with only Epic at the Issue Types
 # Add an Epic child from another project
 # Try to quick create a new Epic Child 
 # There is no error displayed to the end-user

h3. Expected Results

A pop-up message explaining that en Epic can't have another Epic as Child or that there are no Issue Types to create child Issues on the Epic
h3. Actual Results

Nothing, please see attached video:
[^screencast-starless.atlassian.net-2020.08.25-10_43_00.webm]
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: No error when quick creating an Epic child when the project only have Epic Issues created

fields.description:
While creating custom field, it is not checked if field with same name already exist in default or custom field. This allow Admin to create duplicate field and causes confusion when that field is needed to be added in screen or reports, as which one to use.

Refer user feedback on this from community

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-discussions/JIRA-field-with-same-name-Duplicate-Field-names/td-p/693235]

 A feature is required that checks and stops Admin from creating such field.
fields.summary: Stop Allowing Custom Field created with same name as existing default field or custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to attach a file to the case in New Issue View through Attach Button, it fails for few files. Adding same files to the comment is successful
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Open the issue in New Issue View
 * Click on Attach tab and select the File to be attached

!penyu_bug.gif|width=243,height=175!
{noformat}
app: issue
 description: There was an error while uploading a file
 eventNameSuffix: issue.error
 message:
 name: AnalyticError
 stack: AnalyticError
 at t._next (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/async-issue-app~issue.1711cf14547fba8b08c2.8.js:206:290120)
 at t.__tryOrSetError (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~31ecd969.6cbb438be26d681c2ba2.8.js:25:39372)  {noformat}
h3. Expected Results

File should successfully attach to the case
h3. Actual Results

File fails to attach to the issue in new issue view
h3. Workaround
 * Can be attached to the same issue from Old Issue view
fields.summary: Attaching a file to Description fails in New Issue View

fields.description:
{quote}As an automation rule writer
I want an action to edit a variable's value
So I do not clear it every time by using Create Variable
{quote}

Acceptance criteria:
 * There are separate actions for Create Variable and Edit Variable
 * The action Edit Variable supports accessing any built-in or custom fields, and variables. Thus, Edit Variable can refer to itself, such as with concatenation.
 * The scope of the variable is clear and unambiguous, based upon the nesting level at which it Create Variable was called

 

Business Value:
It is unclear how variables work or their scope; specifically, there is no defined way to edit a variable's value. There is an article indicating that defining a variable earlier in a rule makes it available withing structures such as conditions or branches. However, the only available action is Create Variable, which appears to shadow and then replace the value for each usage.
fields.summary: Ability to edit a variable created in a rule with an action

fields.description:
{quote}As an automation rule writer
I want all issue fields available to Lookup Issues
So I can access the valuable information in issues using automation
{quote}
Acceptance criteria:
 * All built-in and custom fields are accessible in Lookup Issues
 * The limit of 100 issues for Lookup Issues remains the same
 * The smart values names used within Lookup Issues matches names used elsewhere. That is, no alternative names are used due to the context within a Lookup Issues list.


Business value:
Providing access to all issue fields within Lookup Issues can simplify rule definition that might otherwise require multiple rules or be impossible to implement with out-of-the-box JIRA.
fields.summary: Make all issue fields available to Lookup Issues

fields.description: It's very hard navigating Atlasssian tickets because of the numerous inconsiderate "+1" comments. These should be automatically converted to a vote and the actual comment rejected. About half the comments on the top-voted features suggestions are usless "+1" comments.
fields.summary: Automatically convert +1 comments to votes

fields.description: As a Cloud customer, I would like to be able to restrict user access to my Cloud site based on our *approved domains* as outlined [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/specify-how-users-get-site-access-744721636.html]. However, currently, Site Admins and Trusted Users are able to override approved domains and invite users outside of our approved domain list.
fields.summary: Restrict User Access Based on Approved Domains

fields.description:
It would be a necessary feature to restrict the user search based on the workflow status. 

The current system does not allow to restrict the search of the user. In the assignee field, It will list all the users and while assigning the workflow property to apply.

We need to restrict the user search based on workflow status.
fields.summary: Restricting user search based on workflow status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The users who are part of the jira-administrators group tend to receive notifications for the below, even though their site access is revoked (not removed from site) and part of the jira-administrator group.
 * Project moved to trash (Not necessarily the user need be a "project lead" of the project)
 * Project deleted from the trash
 * Project will be deleted in "XX" days message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user to jira-administrator group
 # Can give them a "Trusted" role
 # Revoke site access
 # Move the project to trash
 # The user will receive a notification that the "project is moved to trash by xyz"

h3. Expected Results

Notifications should not be sent to the users who do not have site access.
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-08-22-15-33-17-837.png|width=390,height=179!
h3. Workaround

Remove user from jira-administrator group.
fields.summary: No site access - Notification received for moving project to trash.

fields.description:
Recently, the "Lookup Issues" action has been added, allowing users to look up issues by JQL and action them using the {{{{lookupIssues}}}} smart value, which contains the list of issues matching the JQL query.

 

After the value is retrieved, the user may need to perform actions on the issues in the list. However, the Branch Rule dropdown does not contain the Lookup Issues result to select from.

If the user wishes to perform actions on these issues, then he/she will need to select the "JQL" condition in the Branch Rule and to do the same JQL query as originally conducted to retrieve the list. This means that the JQL query is executed twice, making the action take longer than necessary.

 

A potential issue is not all issue properties are made available in the query result ([https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-actions/#Automationactions-Lookupissues]), whereas the user would expect to be able to access all issue properties in a Branch Rule.

 

If the user were able to directly access the Lookup Issues result in the Branch issue dropdown seamlessly, it would be easier for users to access, and it would be more efficient for the server since the JQL query would only be executed once.
fields.summary: Add "Lookup issues" list to Branch Rule selection

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the new JIRA issue view does not offer a way of hiding fields from third party apps.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to hide these fields.
fields.summary: Ability to hide third-party app fields

fields.description:
This feature request is for Jira Align. I was unable to select JA as the project when creating this suggestion.

 

For the Roadmap feature, when adding Custom Columns under View Configuration, we would like T-Shirt size to be a column option. We use this value in workforce planning, so being able to see it on the roadmap is essential to our planning for the upcoming quarters.
fields.summary: JIRA ALIGN: Roadmap T-Shirt size Custom Column

fields.description: As a Jira admin or as an end user, I'd like to have the ability to send the filter subscriptions as a CSV file or a PDF, instead of email or RSS formats as mentioned on this article: [Subscribing to your search results|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver073/working-with-search-results-861257284.html#Workingwithsearchresults-subscribeSubscribingtoyoursearchresults].
fields.summary: Email subscription sent as a CSV format of PDF

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer would like to run a JQL and based on the search results, he would like to change the fix versions on the same page using combo boxes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for issues having Fix versions.{quote} !Screenshot 2020-08-21 at 3.59.40 PM.png|thumbnail! {quote}
 # Users of the project should be able to change the *fix version* using a Combo box.

h3. Expected Results

Admin of the project would like to be able to change the *fix version* using a *Combo box* as that makes it easier for him to discuss about every case and change the *fix version* in the JQL results directly.
h3. Actual Results

 JQL results display all the issues with Fix versions and to change the fix version, users should open the issues in a different tabs or use the bulk issue change option to change the fix versions.
h3. Workaround

As of now the admin uses *Bulk change issues* option after running the JQL query.
fields.summary: Combo box for fix version in "filter list" view

fields.description:
Currently, automation audit logs won't show issue keys unless you expand each log by clicking on 'Show more'.

!print.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested solution

Display the issue key associated with each log next to the execution timestamp.
fields.summary: Display issue keys in audit logs without having to click on 'Show more'

fields.description:
On the [Atlassian cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html] page, the IP ranges for Automation for Jira/Project automation are not listed (e.g., 54.240.11.42).

It would be nice if those IP ranges were added to the article under the *Outbound email* section.
fields.summary: Add IP ranges used by Project automation to send emails to "Atlassian cloud IP ranges and domains" page

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to be possible to create a transition validator that will display a dynamic message when there is more than 2 required fields for a transition to happen to display which fields are empty in a single message.

Currently, it displays that only one field is empty while there is more than one field required empty during the transition.
fields.summary: Dynamic Messaging Based on Transition Validators Required Field(s)

fields.description:
Currently, there are no endpoints that can help the user to fetch creation date, last seen, Access rights, and other such details.

We can use this /rest/api/3/users/search but that will not return the required results hence raising this feature.
fields.summary: API endpoint attributes for detailed information from site admin page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The “development” field is not visible in the new issue view when it is alone set to be “hidden when empty” from the Issue layout. If other fields are included to be hidden when empty with the “Development” field, then on clicking the “show more fields” not show the correct count of fields hidden and the tip tool does not mention the “development” field.
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Drag only the Development field to the "HIDE WHEN EMPTY" section in the Issue layout and save changes.
 # Next, Along with the Development field, add another field that qualifies as empty in the "HIDE WHEN EMPTY" section and save changes.

h3. Expected Results
 # On hiding the Development field alone, the "show 1 more field" link should be visible in the new issue view.
 # If there are more fields hidden with the Development field, the show <NUM> field(s) should reflect the correct number of fields that are hidden and the tip should mention the Development field name along with the other fields that are hidden.

h3. Actual Results
 # In the New issue view, the Development field and the "show 1 more field" link is not visible.
 # It will say "show 1 more field",(total number of fields hidden -1) but there are 2 fields actually hidden! And the tip will not reflect the "Development" field name!

h3. Workaround

Move the development field out of the show more section.
fields.summary: Development field not visible in the "New issue view" if it is hidden alone in the "HIDE WHEN EMPTY" section of the Issue layout.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Uploading any attachment in new issue view takes longer than old view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any ticket
 # Drag and drop any attachment 

h3. Expected Results

Attachment should be uploaded faster in new issue view (similar to old issue view)

h3. Actual Results

Attachment takes longer time to upload in new issue view

h3. Notes

Did some testing by attaching 9Mb csv file and here are the results:
* Old issue view: 4-7 secs (/) 
* New issue view: 2-5 min (x)

h3. Workaround

* Disable new issue view (Jira Labs) from profile settings (It won't work for next-gen projects)
** https://URL.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
* Add *?oldIssueView=true* at the end of the URL
** https://URL.atlassian.net/browse/<issue key>*?oldIssueView=true*
fields.summary: Improve attachment upload speed in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users cannot clone issues if the *field required validator* includes the field *Attachment*.
 - If the field required validator which checks for the field Attachment is added to the initial create transition in the workflow, then the creation of tickets with attachments work as expected. However, cloning the same issue (with attachments) results in the error defined in the validator.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project.
 # Add the field required validator to the initial create transition in the workflow that checks for the field Attachment.
 # Create a new issue in the project with an attachment (_Issue is successfully created as expected_)
 # Clone the newly created issue with attachments (_Clone operation fails with the error defined in the validator._)

h3. Expected Results

Clone operation should succeed as the validated field "Attachment" is present in the issue.
h3. Actual Results

Clone operation fails with the error defined in the validator.
h3. Workaround

The workaround to successfully clone the issue is to remove the field "Attachment" from the field required validator in the project workflow.
fields.summary: Users cannot clone issues if the field required workflow validator includes the field Attachment.

fields.description:
In project management there are several complex, fast moving types that consolidate structure and decision history. Examples are Projects, sprints, versions, teams, plans, initiatives, and others that provide context and completeness for the rest of the complex, comprehensive related tables that provide the composite, complete history of a project.

These types deserve recognition of their critical role in an integrated project model. And they should be handled as critical project assets: backup, restore, analysis, diagnosis, etc.

However, there is another scenario/use case that surrounds the creation process for many of those same types, when the concerns appropriate to a fully integrated data system is not yet in place, is under construction, design, evaluation, and review. 

That use case requires that a project manager, architect, or product manager be able to move through their task load rapidly and flexibly. The ability to actually DELETE an application (Jira application) data structure of complex and rich integration capability whenever, and however, and completely, as needed.

Can we not have both, please? Having to stop the implementation phase of a complex re-design of projects, issue types, plans, boards, versions, initiatives, epics and stories just because concerns at the very antipode of the design and configuration phase of the project require that special treatment... its just stupid to be presented with a 30-day stop work notice because of a spelling error, naming conflict, need to include 'just one more' nuance, and so forth!

Please give use the ability to make up our own mind about what's more important to us during design, even though we want exactly the opposite behavior when we are closing down our project after its completed!?!

Just allow us to delete a project, or repo, or any other crucial structure IF WE THINK IT IS NECESSARY as long as their is no data in it, or if we are willing to sign in blood on twitter or some such maxi-public platform!

And then just DO IT! just like we asked.

Thanks,

Kimball Johnson
fields.summary: Please acknowledge that there are two scenarios/use cases for deleting projects

fields.description:
A robust story (product backlog item; issue) can include a long conversation. If there is a critical comment that doesn't belong in the definition of a story (e.g., Use/consult this sandboxed code/experiment), it would be incredibly useful to *highlight it as important*.

I suppose by suggesting pinning the comment, I'm specifying a solution. The real need is to highlight a comment as important. I think pinning comments would be a reasonable solution though. Thanks.
fields.summary: Pin a Comment on an Issue

fields.description:
As a user, it would be great to have better granularity for the *Delete Issues* permission, for example, set that permission based on a specific Issue type.

Example: 
* User A has permission to delete Stories
* User B has permission to delete Bugs and Tasks
fields.summary: Delete Issues permission based on Issue type

fields.description: With the Archive Project feature, I would like to have an option to access all the issues from the archived project without restoring it as a view mode only
fields.summary: With the Archive Project feature, I would like to have an option to access all the issues from the archived project without restoring it as a view mode only

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Administrators (users that are part of any group with the *Jira Administration* permission) that had their site access revoked, but weren't removed from those groups still receive emails about projects being archived or moved to trash.
* The project titles might contain sensitive information to the company and knowing the project is archived or trashed can be impactful

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Toggle off the *Has access on site* button for a user that is Jira Administrator (keep them on those groups)
 ** !image-2020-08-19-14-19-03-920.png|width=314,height=351!
 # Archive or move a project to the trash

h3. Expected Results

Jira Administrators that had their site access revoked shouldn't receive any emails about projects that were archived or moved to trash.

h3. Actual Results

The users that were Jira Administrators keep receiving emails when a project is archived or moved to the trash. These users will get information like:
 * The project name
 * Who performed that action
 * When that was performed
 * And the link for that instance

h3. Workaround

The only thing that can be done to fix this is to remove that user from all the Jira Administration groups.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira Administrators without site access still receive emails about projects being archived or moved to trash

fields.description:
When the user creates a notification for when someone comments on an issue, using automation rules, if a user @mention other users on the comment, the that receives the notification is seeing the userID instead of the username.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create an automation rule like the image attached
 # Confirm that, in "*more options*", the *send as* field is configured with HTML.
 # Save it.
 # Now, mention someone in the comment.

*Expected results*: The user receives the notification showing the user mention as a username or complete name.

*Actual results*: The user receives the notification showing the user mention as userID.
fields.summary: Automation rules send notification showing the UserID instead of the name after @mention

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Call on `/rest/api/3/permissions/check` returns 5xx response codes when `projects` or `permissions` in request body contains `null` value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make a `POST` request on `/rest/api/3/permissions/check` endpoint with `projects` equal `[ null ]` in request body
 # 5xx Response received

h3. Expected Results

Call with `null` in `projects` or `permissions` should return 4xx code. 
(Probably 400 or 404) 
h3. Actual Results
Call with `null` in `projects` or `permissions`  returns 5xx code. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Fix bug in `rest/api/*/permissions/check` that causes 5xx response codes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For some customers, when using Chrome, even though all the extensions are disabled and/or using incognito windows, when clicking on "All Issues" (/jira/software/c/projects/<projectKey>/issues?filter=allissues), the issue search does not show all the issues that are part of the project or that are a result from the filter you do.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

This does not happen to all the users that use Chrome browser, so it was not possible to reproduce this. On this cases, the issue needs to be verified during a call meeting with the customer.
h3. Expected Results

You should be able to use the scroll feature to access all the issues:

!image-2020-08-18-18-43-56-429.png|width=296,height=524!
h3. Actual Results

At first, the scroll bar is correctly shown. However, after some seconds (around 1-2 seconds max) it gets broken, not allowing the user to acccess all the issues:

!image-2020-08-18-18-44-35-431.png|width=222,height=393!
h3. Workaround

The only workaround by now is to use another browser. We've confirmed that this works fine when using Edge.
fields.summary: Scroll bar does not allow the user to access all issues in issues search

fields.description: Would appreciate smart links for @Guru_HQ! ([https://www.getguru.com/features]) We're creating Guru cards for long-lived bugs. Would also appreciate some sort of integration 🤗
fields.summary: Create a Guru integration for Jira Cloud

fields.description: Currently, a field being *Hidden* in the *Field configuration* makes it to where *Project automation* can't see and act on it. Sometimes, it is desired to have a field set to *Hidden* in the UI via the *Field configuration*, but still have *Project automation* see and act on the field.
fields.summary: Allow Project automation to see and act on hidden fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user changes restriction roles to any ticket, automation fails to trigger transition rules. due missing permissions from actor (addon_com.codebarrel.addons.automation

addon_com.codebarrel.addons.automation user is not able to read issues that are restricted to other roles where this user is not assigned (by default is assigned to *atlassian-addons-project-access* role), you cannot add roles to this user, because security groups or the user itself is not assignable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule that is triggered in any transition.
 # Create an issue.
 # Change restrictions to the *Administrator* role only.
 # Transition this issue.
 # Automation rule must fail due to a lack of permissions on Actor.

h3. Expected Results
Rule Execution

h3. Actual Results
Actor does not have permission to view one or more issues, or the issue was deleted (please check permissions and issue security levels):
Comment (id:10134) for issue NGS-1 (id:10163)

h3. Workaround
We can add this user to any role using email instead of username and this solves the issue(com.codebarrel.addons.automation@connect.atlassian.com). But this is not what is expected from this solution, fact that we are able to find this user with just email is another bug that in this case is helping.
fields.summary: When an issue on Next-Gen has group restrictions, automation fails to execute for lacking permissions for the Actor.

fields.description:
+*Issue :*+ 

Currently, when we add a validator to a transition and when the issue did not comply with the validator specified, it will display each the error one by one. (ie. it will display first field which did not comply and once that is resolved, it will display the second field that did not comply and so on.) which is time consuming and tedious.

+*References :*+ 

In a scenario, where I added validator on fields Description, Due Date and Attachment as required before transitioning to the status. 

!image-2020-08-20-15-40-37-631.png|width=447,height=227!  

We get an error as below : (when all the 3 are not entered) 

!image-2020-08-20-15-41-11-993.png|width=293,height=214!

We get an error as below : (when description and due date is entered)

!image-2020-08-20-15-41-53-421.png|width=233,height=208!

+*Suggestion :*+ 

It would be good if we get the 3 field in the same error window rather than having them separately after completing one.
fields.summary: Validator displays each validation message separately

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Glances that require endpoints like 

 
{code:java}
/rest/atlassian-connect/1/addons/{addonKey}/properties
{code}
Which, from the documentation here: [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-app-properties/#api-group-app-properties] can only be called by the app itself: !image-2020-08-18-13-27-21-465.png|width=559,height=216!

Are failing in the native Android, iOS and Mac clients. This is because from these clients, we are not sending the Ap-Client-Key with the request from these clients, so the permission check that ensures this endpoint is only called by the connect app is failing. We need to include this key in the requests from the mobile clients.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any glance in the mobile app and from the javascript console call
{code:java}
AP.request('/rest/atlassian-connect/1/addons/{addonKey}/properties')
 .then(data => console.log(data.body))
 .catch(e => console.log(e.err));{code}

 (or open a glance that requires any of these endpoints and see the errors in the console)

h3. Expected Results

We get the results of this endpoint and a successful HTTP response
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
{"status-code":404,"message":"App with key does not exist."}{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround - don't enable your glance if you require these endpoints for it to function until this issue is resolved.
fields.summary: Making requests from glances to endpoints that can only be accessed by the application itself fail in mobile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
PDF Files with 'Comments' do not render correctly to the viewer
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a PDF file that contains a Comment inside

h3. Expected Results
Hover the mouse and show the comment from the PDF file viewer
h3. Actual Results
No comment is shown:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: PDF Files with 'Comments' do not render correctly to the viewer

fields.description:
It'd be nice to customize the Issue Layout field ordering and display on a per-user basis or by next-gen permissions/roles.

For some organizations, certain roles in our org rely on some fields more than others and it can be hard to get a layout that satisfies all users.
fields.summary: Customize issue layout by roles/user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Can not open issues in the new tab from the board itself.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Clicking on the issue in the board does not open in the new tab in the browser (or)
 * Right-click on an issue from the board does not open in the new tab in browser.

h3. Expected Results
{noformat}
Clicking on an issue from the board should open the issue in a new tab in the browser.{noformat}
h3. Workaround

- Open the issue first and then click on the issue key to open in a new tab in the browser.
fields.summary: Can not open issue in new tab from board anymore, ...

fields.description: At the moment, checksum is used to check the integrity of files uploaded in Atlassian. Provide the ability to disable checksum.
fields.summary: Ability to disable chesksum

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the issue view is opened in a dialog (e.g. above a board), the dialogs such as the feedback dialog causes any open glance panel to be rendered out of place. This issue was created in response to [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/problems-displaying-dialog-over-issue-dialog/40727].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a board.
 # View an issue such that it’s opened as a dialog above the board.
 # Open a glance panel that is high enough to be scrollable.
 # Open any dialog, e.g. “Give feedback”.
 # The glance panel goes outside of the issue dialog.

h3. Expected Results

The bounds of the glance web panel is unaffected.
h3. Actual Results

The bounds of the glance web panel is pushed down. See the attachment for more details.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Opening a dialog in the issue view results in the glance panel rendering out of place

fields.description:
Some issues contain large body of texts and / or images. It would be great if I could collapse sidebar and make content full width. It would also make it full screen, Confluence-like reading experience.

!image-2020-08-16-11-20-41-738.png!
fields.summary: Collapse sidebar in issue detail view

fields.description:
Currently, changing the date format of the data picker custom field(for example:as dd/mm/yyyy or yyyy/mm/dd) is available as a *global config for jira* and *not project specific*. 
We would like to have this feature as *project specific* as well.
fields.summary: Change the date format of the Date Picker custom field for specific projects

fields.description:
In case the comment content is big in the Jira Cloud app on Mac, we cannot see the complete content without scrolling the comment-box size which is not very user-friendly.

I am attaching a screen-recording for more reference.
fields.summary: Allow to increase text-input box size of the comment box of the desktop app in Mac
API responses suddenly missing emailAddress field for few users and few appears

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding the post-function "Set issue security level based on user's project role" in the create issue transition doesn't set the security level while adding the same post-function to any other transition does.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add two users to JIRA. For example User A and User B;
# Create a project;
# In the project's *People* add User A to project role *Administrators*, and add User B to project role *Developers*;
# Create an issue security scheme (i.e. Test Security Scheme) with following security levels:
** Level A (Default)
** Level B
# Associate this issue security scheme with the project;
# Edit the project's workflow and add the following post-functions to *Create Issue* transition using the post-function *Set issue security level based on user's project role*:
** If user is a member of the *Administrators* role, set issue security level to *Level A* (Test Security Scheme).
** If user is a member of the *Developers* role, set issue security level to *Level B* (Test Security Scheme).
# Log in as *User A* (Administrators) and create an issue in the project. For example *Test Issue*.

h3. Expected Results
The security level "*Level A*" should be set to the issue.

h3. Actual Results
The security level is not set. This can be checked using the [GET Issue API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-get] and looking for (command/ctrl + F) the field *security*.

h3. Notes
If the same post-function is added to any other transition, for example *In Progress*, the security level is correctly set.

h3. Workaround
* Transfer the post-function to any other transition than the Create Issue transition;
OR
* Use the Automation example below to set the security level.
 !Screen Shot 2020-08-13 at 16.36.48.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Post-function "Set issue security level based on user's project role" doesn't work on Issue Created transition

fields.description:
# BigGantt by SoftwarePlant

 ## Ideal for waterfall workflows, our Gantt chart can be used to create reports, or to simply keep stakeholders and team members in the loop. In agile processes, it can be used to depict a portfolio level of ongoing projects.

 ## Set up critical path, time markers, baselines quickly and easily

 ## Manage resources: capacity, (under-/over-) allocation

 ## Export to Microsoft Excel and Project [with BigTemplate|[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215229/bigtemplate-export-to-pdf-word-excel]]

 # Structure by ALM Works

 ## Project Management at Scale looks like a new app that would help The PMO report on projects.

 ## Maximize visibility and achieve your project portfolio management (PPM) reporting goals

 ## Visualize, track and manage projects at scale with an adaptable, user-defined issue hierarchy

 # BigPicture by SoftwarePlant

 ## Project Management & PPM Roadmap, Resources, Risk Management. SAFe®, Portfolio for Jira Compliant. Project Portfolio Management (PPM) & Resource

 * Introducing new-level Project Portfolio Management to Jira! BigPicture makes it easy to build and manage multiple projects. Tried and tested, suitable for MS Project converts, fully Agile Jira-only folks and Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe®) enthusiasts.

 * BigPicture features the same Gantt chart as our other plugin, BigGantt – [the best-rated Gantt chart|[https://wiki.softwareplant.com/display/COMPARE/Gantt+chart+comparison]]plugin

 # Advanced Roadmaps (formerly Portfolio) by Atlassian

 ## Advanced Roadmaps for Jira helps you build a plan, see the big picture, track progress, and easily share with stakeholders

 ## Understand the scope of your teams' work. Auto-schedule your issues or plan manually.

 ## Track dependencies across multiple teams and projects to get ahead of bottlenecks and blockers that could impact how quickly work gets done.

 # BigPicture for Trello

 * Adds a Gantt chart feature to make planning even more fun using Trello’s one-of-a-kind style and simplicity. Big Picture Power-Up, you can expand beyond a simple board, and venture into hybrid Project Management territory.

 

*Tricia Cook, PMP*| Project Manager Lead

*CallMiner Eureka* – Intelligence from Customer Interactions

12800 University Dr #500, Fort Myers, FL 33907

Office: 239.268.3230
fields.summary: Suggestion for Plugin for Jira / Trello

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if you add a Custom Field of *Number of comments* type, it is not displayed on the New Issue View.

Old Issue View:

!image-2020-08-13-12-24-10-540.png|width=713,height=270!

New Issue View:

!image-2020-08-13-12-27-15-057.png!
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability of the New Issue View to display the Custom Fields of *Number of comments* type
h3. Why this is important

This should enhance greatly the user experience.
h3. Workaround 

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Number of Comments Custom Fields are not displayed on the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deactivated Slack users are being invited to Jira
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Be a Slack admin  + Jira Site Admin
# Go to a channel with >1 members
# Deactivate one of the members of the channel whose email is not a user of Jira
# Send a Jira link
# Get prompted to invite people
# Decide to invite everyone
# Invitations will be sent to the Deactivated members of Slack

h3. Expected Results

Send invite-only to Active users
h3. Actual Results
All users get the invite even if they were deactivated from Slack
h3. Workaround

Do not use the *Add all users* who don’t have access, use the *Choose users* so you can select users that are not deactivated from Slack
fields.summary: Deactivated Slack users are being invited to Jira

fields.description:
It'd be great to extend the existing JQL development queries to improve usability around querying this info. 

Something like development[reviews].reviewer in (currentUser()) would be great.
fields.summary: Ability to query review/user information from Development section using JQL

fields.description: Currently, only the Project Admin or the Jira administrator can create or edit a Project Component. We would like it added to the Permission scheme, so we can create our own role to grant access to create/edit/delete Components without needing full admin rights.
fields.summary: Add creating/editing/deleting Components to Permission Scheme

fields.description:
It's too frustrating to lose your steps if you restart PC and have not hit Save in dialogue.

In this case Steps Dialogue is a disadvantage against non-dialogue way.
fields.summary: Make Test Steps Dialogue auto-save steps when dialogue is closed

fields.description: In next-gen, I receive an on-page notification each time I self-assign and/or watch an issue. I don't believe this is necessary and would like the ability to switch this off.
fields.summary: Allow users to turn off confirmation notifications in next-gen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Can’t set decimal value for story points field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start creating issue (using plus button)
# Add a decimal number to story points field (e.g. 2.5)
# Click "Create”

h3. Expected Results
The issue should have story points value user entered.

h3. Actual Results
Story points field is empty.

App version: 110

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can’t set decimal value for story points field on Jira for Mac app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

user_created webhook event does not seem to fire when a new user is added to an instance under any circumstances.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1. Create a webhook for the user created event 
 # Step 2. Add a user by any method.

h3. Expected Results

Webhook for the created user is fired

h3. Actual Results

Webhook is never sent

h3. Workaround

Use the REST API for Jira to periodically poll for new users.
fields.summary: user_created Webhook does not seem to fire when a user is added to Jira/Confluence

fields.description:
Currently Automation for Jira only supports simple if/else blocks. 

While the nested if/else requirement is being tracked here at [https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1063], it would also be beneficial to have Automation support switch case statement based logic as well.
fields.summary: Introduce native switch case logic support to Automation

fields.description:
By default, Jira Software default hierarchy contains:

* *Epics* - Once the higher-level priorities are settled it's necessary to break them down into large pieces of work, which consist of multiple stories.
* *Stories/Tasks* - User stories capture functionality requirements.
* *Sub-task* - Work components that makeup stories.

Currently, Advanced Roadmaps offers the ability to create new, unlimited hierarchy levels as well as getting a 'big picture' view of your projects and tasks in Jira Software or Jira Core, but it uses custom issue types at the same level of "Stories/Tasks" and it was an adaptation provided by the Advanced Roadmaps tool.

As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to create hierarchy levels directly in Jira Software, without the necessity of the adaptation of the level of "Stories/Tasks".
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to have support to Initiatives and other levels by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

+Manage Sprints permission+ will not work as they should for projects that have a complex filter for users that aren't Jira-administrator if one of the projects is archived.

*How to know if the filter is complex?*

You'll see the following message on your Board Setting page:
{panel:title=Projects in board}
We can't show the projects on this board, because the board's filter doesn't specify any. Your users may have trouble managing issues and sprints on this board. Try including some projects in the filter to fix this.
{panel}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a user/group set with the Manage Sprints permission for all projects
 # Have a Scrum project using a complex filter on its board
 # Ensure that the user is capable of Managing Sprints and that the user is not part of the groups that allow the *Global Administer Jira permission*
 # Archive a random project
 # Check again and see that the user is not capable of managing sprints anymore

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to manage sprints on a project that has a complex filter.
h3. Actual Results

The user is unable to manage sprints on the project that has a complex filter. They would receive the following message:

!image-2020-08-12-15-25-35-597.png|width=460,height=214!
h3. Workaround

Right now, the only known workaround is to restore the archived project, delete it (moving to trash should also work) or change the filter specifying the projects that you need.
fields.summary: Manage Sprint permission breaks on project with a complex filter if any project is archived

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In case your project's avatar is broken, for some reason, and the project is moved to the trash, a visual bug happens where there is a text overlay with the project's name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Considering that this happens when there is some issue with the project's avatar, there is no direct way of testing this. Nevertheless, we can use the *Block Request URL* option from the browser's console:
# Move a project to the Trash
# Go to your trash ([https://YOUR_INSTANCE.atlassian.net/jira/settings/projects/trash])
# Access the browser's console (inspect option) and go to the Network tab
# Click on the projectavatar option and select *Block Request URL* (like the screenshot below)
# Refresh the page

!image-2020-08-12-11-47-13-896.png|width=1126,height=619!
h3. Expected Results
The Manage projects page works well doing this:
!image-2020-08-12-12-13-06-455.png|width=549,height=190!
h3. Actual Results
The Trash page doesn't handle this issue yet:
 !image-2020-08-12-12-14-14-137.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Broken Project's Avatar causes a visual bug in the trashed projects page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The independent scrolling feature is being rolled out to the issue view. That will have the view be split between the description area, and the custom fields area (on the right side of the screen), each part with its own scrolling.

Some users might prefer to not use it.

h3. Suggestion

Implement an option so users can choose whether to use the independent scrolling feature or not.
fields.summary: Ability to deactivate the independent scrolling in the issue view
#changelog formula doesn't work with Components and Fix Version fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When uploading a data.zip to the media import feature it is getting stuck at 99% of the uploading process
h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# zip the data folder of Jira
# Go to Settings > System > Restore System and select *Import Media*
# Select your zip file and start the upload

h3. Expected Results
The upload should conclude the file should start to be processed by the importer
h3. Actual Results
The upload gets stuck on 99% 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Upload of media file for import is getting stuck at 99%

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When downloading more than 500 attachments from the issue fails
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the Download All from an issue that has more than 500 attachments in the Old Issue view

h3. Expected Results
Zip file with all attachments
h3. Actual Results
Page Unavailable screen:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Create a Backup fro Jira Cloud and include all attachments following the guidelines provided in [Exporting issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/exporting-issues-776636787.html]
fields.summary: When downloading more than 500 attachments from issue fails

fields.description:
Currently, there is no field that could be added in the issue search list view that displays the status of the linked issues, also Jira search results don't show duplicated results so there is no workaround to display multiple linked issues status.

Customer comment about this request
{quote}
This will allow our developers to spend more time on developing and less time on client communications, we use the tickets for client and the tasks for our sprint, the devs, Product Owners and CLient can communicate on the ticket.

Having the status of the "Task" would allow the client to see the progress of all their open tickets and save us time.

It's getting to the point now where we are losing money on client communication, but it's such a pain point in our industry that we can't go without it.
{quote}
fields.summary: Add the Status of linked tasks in the list view of all tasks

fields.description:
For now, there is no way for the customer to know who/when/what changed/deleted the context of a custom field. 

It would be great if this information is added to the audit logs.
fields.summary: Audit logs don't show when somebody edit/remove the context of a custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With non-batched notifications, the Issue Assigned notification is sent without the assignee name on the field

*Environment*
Edit a notification scheme so the issue assigned notification is sent only to the Current Assignee

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# *Optional* set your personal settings to receive notifications of changes you make
# Assign an issue to yourself
# Assign the issue to another user
# Assign it back to yourself

h3. Expected Results
The notification will be sent with the assigned user on the assignee field

h3. Actual Results
The assigned user is mentioned on the update title "User 1 assigned issue to User 2", but the field itself is empty

!Screen Shot 2020-08-11 at 10.38.34.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Non-batched Issue Assigned notifications are sent without the Assignee field data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
By default, when user add existing issue key in Description field during issue creation , it will automatically convert it to [Smart Link|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/Introducing-Smart-Links-a-richer-way-to-hyperlink/ba-p/1412786] and user can click it and open the issue in the same page. However, for issue using xxx.jira.com domain , the smart link doesn't work but the issuekey converted to https://xxxx.jira.com/browse/TicketNumber#icft=TicketNumber format and it can't be open in the same page. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to JIRA instance with xxxx.jira.com domain
 # Click *Create* to create an issue.
# For Description, add any existing issue key in the same instance.
# Once the issue created, open the issue and click the link created in the "Description" field.

h3. Expected Results
The link can be open in the same page.

h3. Actual Results
The link can't be open in the same page. User need to right click and open in a new tab.

h3. Workaround
Users need to right-click and open in a new tab.
fields.summary: Smart link doesn't work for instance using xxx.jira.com domain

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using custom events in post function of a transition, when using A4J it wont recognize the same.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule to have issue transition trigger
 # For the transition in the post function of the workflow edit the event to any "custom event"
 # automation rule will not trigger in this process.
 # other transitions with generic event works.

h3. Expected Results

The rule should be triggered
h3. Actual Results

No action will be taken
h3. Workaround

To use generic event.
fields.summary: Custom events in post function is not recognized by A4J

fields.description:
h4. Summary

In the New Editor, when users type Atlassian product names, they will automatically format to the desired format.
h4. Example

JIRA or jira > Jira
 BitBucket > Bitbucket
 HipChat > Hipchat
h4. Solution

Users want the ability to choose whether or not this occurs. Provide a way to disable the formatting of Atlassian products if users do not desire it.
h4. Workaround

After the text is autoformatted, ctrl+Z (Windows) or cmd+Z (macOS) will revert the change.
fields.summary: Ability to disable autocorrecting of Atlassian product names in new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Enable comment to be required on the board when you click to add "Flag" into an issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any board from classic software.
 # Right-click on any card and then select "Add flag".
 # Result: It will show a screen with the flag and a comment field.

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to select this comment field as required.
h3. Actual Results

We cannot set the comment field as required.
h3. Workaround

We don't figure out any workaround yet.
fields.summary: Enable comment to be required on the board when you click to add "Flag" into an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By now it's not possible to customize dialog screens for operations as, for example, _Edit Sprint_.
h3. Expected Results

It would be nice if the user might customize dialog screens in order to fit the process, similar to what is done with Create Issue Screen/View Issue Screen and Edit Issue Screen. For example, on Edit Sprints dialog screen:

!image-2020-08-10-17-19-55-934.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

It's not possible to customize (add fields) to dialog screens on Jira.

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Possibility to add fields to Dialog Screens

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cloned comments using Automation shows images as "Failed to load" when using the New issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Create the following automation rule.
 ## !Screen Shot 2020-08-04 at 13.27.57.png|width=284,height=372!
 # Clone a Service Desk ticket.
 # On the original ticket, add an internal comment with an image. 

h3. Expected Results

On the cloned ticket, it will show the same comment from the original ticket and the image will show correctly.

!Screen Shot 2020-08-04 at 13.30.25.png|width=471,height=322!
h3. Actual Results

It shows "Failed to load".

!Screen Shot 2020-08-04 at 13.30.56.png|width=402,height=386!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cloned comments using Automation shows images as "Failed to load"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In NextGen board and backlogs, label filters are shown before the issue type filter by default. This may cause inconvenience to users who want to check the issue types first.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Story and a Bug in a NextGen Project.
 # Add labels to the Story and the Bug.
 # Create a Sprint with the Story and the Bug.
 # The label filter will appear before the issue type filter in the board and the backlogs.

h3. Expected Results

There should be an option to configure the filter order in the NextGen board and the backlogs.
h3. Actual Results

The label filter is shown before the issue type filter which may cause inconvenience to some users.

h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Ability to configure the filter order in NextGen board and backlogs.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When doing a bulk update for and clicking on edit issue.
It will show error :
Unavailable Actions
 !JiraBulk-Edit-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Do a search in filter navigator
 # Click on (...) > Bulk change all
 # Choose the issues and click on next
 # Click on edit issues and next

h3. Expected Results
Show the list of actions to do bulk edit

h3. Actual Results
 !JiraBulk-Edit-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Unable to perform bulk edit operations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira we allow users to create comments from incoming email. Large incoming mails of this nature can intermittently cause  many duplicate comments. This is because the *default mail server* engine calls it repeatedly. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # The instance has been setup to process incoming mail on default mail server
 # An email update is done by any participating user at a Jira Issue
 # Email Handler takes that one email update and adds it multiple times at the corresponding Jira issue as multiple comments.

h3. Expected Results

There should be only one update per email as a single comment into the Jira Issue
h3. Actual Results

Multiple emails were sent by the mail engine on a single email , potentially as an architectural retry to ensure mail was sent successfully. Checking backend logs show that any one email and its specific messageId can be processed up to hundreds of times, which in return shows that each mail were updated that many times as separate comments but redundant and duplicate comments into the Jira Issue.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. As best practise , please try to ensure that Jira issues are maintained within a healthy size limit of comment - these issues seem more apparent in issues that already have more then 200 comments. Another point to review would be using external mail servers if issue persists as a workaround.
fields.summary: Jira causes redundant duplicate comment creation when handling large incoming mails

fields.description: At present, the entry in the issue history for Automation changes does not have the A4J Rule that was triggered. It would be great to have a reference to the Automation rule in issue "History" tab (or somewhere else), so that we can easily track down a rule causing undesired side effects.
fields.summary: Reference to automation rule in issue history

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Currently, when users perform updates in the workflow, we're not able to track down which changes were performed once the draft is published. In case of mistaken changes have been performed, users aren't able to recover their own main draft.

h3. Why is it important?
This would help customers through mistaken updates/changes by adding a history of updates in workflows as currently, our only possibility is to rollback the instance to undo the changes and by performing it, other changes are undone as well.
fields.summary: Store workflow changes in project history

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*
Currently, the CSV file exported from the search result contains username for user picker fields such as Reporter and Assignee fields when the user has been invited from the Project itself. This causes the users to appear as not human-readable values/strings in assignee and reporter fields.

*Steps to Reproduce*
1. Go to the Project's People section.
2. Click "Add People" > Add a new user to your instance.
3. This adds the new user as Atlassian Account ID in the Username table.

*Expected Results*
The best result would be that the CSV file contains a display name or email address for the reporter and assignee field.

*Actual Results*
The username appears in the assignee field which will be a AAID.
fields.summary: CSV export should contain display names for user picker field like reporter and assignee fields

fields.description: As we understand, few fields like description field is hardcoded and cannot be changed in the Jira iOS app and hence doesn't respect the field order as configured in Jira Cloud site.
fields.summary: Jira iOS app doesn't respect the field order as configured in Jira Cloud site.

fields.description: Provide a compressed view for Jira for those using Jira on a small laptop or iPad. It takes up a large amount of vertical space on a 13" MBP, for example.
fields.summary: Provide the option of a compressed view in next-gen

fields.description:
|*Atlassian Update - 20 May 2021*|
|Hi everyone,
 This ticket has now been completed. Message custom fields (for view) now appear as read only and support rich text functionality. 
  
 Thanks,
 The Atlassian Cloud team|

 

 

Fix the way the Message Custom Field is shown on the New Issue View:
h3. Example of usage for this field:

!image-2020-08-06-20-35-56-212.png|width=541,height=213!
h3. Old Issue View:

!image-2020-08-06-20-36-34-923.png|width=469,height=150!
h3. New Issue View:

!image-2020-08-06-20-36-48-649.png|width=525,height=86!
fields.summary: Fix the way the Message Custom Field is shown on New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On clicking connected apps, we see an error - Something went wrong
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to admin.atlassian.com
 # Click on connected apps

h3. Expected Results

It should load fine
h3. Actual Results

It throws error as shown in screenshot (details in the support ticket)
fields.summary: Connected apps section under user management throws error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some headers from Gadgets on Dashboards are not easily readable when using the *View as wallboard* functionality
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select a Dashboard created
 # Select View as wallboard

h3. Expected Results
Should be black background color with all Gadgets displaying the data:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
Some header from the gadgets are not easily readable:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some headers from Gadgets on Dashboards are not easily readable using Wallboard function

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User having both the Portal as well as license account appears twice in the People. To fix this problem the Admin has to choose *Migrate to Atlassian Account* for these accounts. But, if the number of such cases are high it creates additional manual work for the Admin. 

So, system should be capable to identify such cases and merge both the accounts.

 !Duplicate Name.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Problem Definition

* Create Portal only customer
* Add same email address as a licensed user from the user management
* Go to the People page, this user will appear twice
* Now, navigate back to the Portal customer list and select *Migrate to Atlassian account* from the More options dropdown
* Duplicate username will be resolved in the people page

h3. Why this is important

As mentioned in the [Manage JSD customer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html#How%20can%20I%20give%20licenses%20to%20customers%20I%20want%20to%20collaborate%20with%20in%20Jira%20or%20Confluence?] document, Admin needs to migrate user with the same email address from Portal to Atlassian Account.

However, if the site has more such cases it becomes additional manual work for the Admins.

h3. Workaround 

Migrate the portal customer to the Atlassian account.
fields.summary: Migration of Portal user should be automatic to Atlassian Access if the email address is same

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During issue creation, you can paste an image into the *Description* by copying an image from your desktop, or other sources (e.g. Snagit).

Currently, the behaviour is inconsistent in the issue creation screen (be it a standard issue, or sub-task) from the agile view (backlog, kanban board, sprint view).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Access an agile board's view (backlog, kanban board view, sprint view)
* Copy an image from your desktop;
* Try pasting the image into the *Description* field.

h3. Expected Results

Jira will upload the image to the issue, creating the thumbnail in the Description field.

h3. Actual Results

Most of the time, nothing happens. 

Sometime, when you navigate back and forth between the agile view and other views, the thumbnail will be created, but no image will be uploaded at all. Or, sometime, two thumbnails and images will be created from a single CTRL + V, although only one of them will be uploaded:
 !Screen Shot 2020-08-06 at 10.18.14.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

It seems that it works correctly from other views such as the issue full view (opening an single issue in a separate tab), or the project list. 

Of course, the manual upload file button is working correctly as well.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behaviour when attempting to paste an image when creating an issue from the agile view

fields.description:
Under the *View all projects* page, users can easily sort by their projects by Name, Key, Lead and Category. The *Type* column is the only one not available for this.
If we allow users to do that, they can easily identify their next-gen projects directly from the UI. For customers that have too many possible, it's very difficult to do that without contacting support or using REST API.
 !View all projects.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow users to sort projects by Type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user logs into Jira from the mobile app the session does not have an inactivity time out as it happens for browser sessions
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # log into Jira Cloud from the mobile app
 # leave it idle for ... any time
 # you will not be logged out

h3. Expected Results

One would expect that there is an inactivity timeout of some sort. This could be the same as the browser defined timeout at the organization level, or a specific timeout for mobile sessions, considering that mobile experience is different and users are not used to be timed out. In any case no timeout at all is a serious security problem (one that is becoming more and more critical following the COVID crisis)
h3. Actual Results

The user is never logged out
h3. Workaround

The only available workaround for the Admin seems to be to deactivate the user. 1h after deactivation the user will be kicked out of the mobile session
fields.summary: When logging in Jira from the mobile app the session does not expire

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the quick search bar (on the top right) from a Jira Issue view screen, if you paste an image on it (even when focused), the image will be attached to Jira ticket.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy an image to your clipboard
# Click on the quick search (to focus it)
# Paste the content with the image

h3. Expected Results
* Since the quick search doesn't use images, the pasting would be ignored, avoiding unwanted attachments to be added in the ticket.
* Whenever focusing on the quick search, we don't expect changes to happen on the ticket.

h3. Actual Results
* Images can be accidentally pasted on tickets, in a very "quiet" way, which can be unnoticed, Jira also does not confirm if you want to add that attachment or not, it just gets uploaded right away.

Here is a video showing this behavior:
 [^Reproducing_bug.mp4] 


h3. Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Using the quick search can accidentally add an image to a ticket when using copy and paste

fields.description:
Currently, when you go to a project and click the *Issues* option in the left menu, you're redirected to the *All issues* filter.

People generally want to look at open issues so it would be better to be redirected *Open issues* instead of *All issues*.

As a Jira user, I want the "Issues" option in the project view to redirect to "Open issues"
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want the "Issues" option in the project view to redirect to "Open issues"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Delete" key removes 2 characters or more while editing text in the Mac Jira App
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access the Jira Mac App
 # Go to a search field or text field and type a text
 # Use the "Delete" key to remove characters

!Screen Recording 2020-08-05 at 02.41.42 PM.gif|width=609,height=338!
h3. Expected Results

It removes only one character at the time
h3. Actual Results

It removes two or more characters at the time
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The "Delete" key removes 2 characters or more while editing text in the Mac Jira App
